info.title: Vulmatch API
info.description:
Vulmatch is a database of CVEs in STIX 2.1 format with a REST API wrapper to access them.


[DOGESEC](https://www.dogesec.com/) offer a fully hosted web version of Vulmatch which includes many additional features over those in this codebase. [You can find out more about the web version here](https://www.vulmatch.com/).

get.description:
Search and filter CPE records.

This endpoint only returns the `software` objects for matching CPEs.

This endpoint is useful to find CPEs that can be used to filter CVEs.

parameters.name: cpe_match_string
parameters.description: Filter CPEs that contain a full or partial CPE Match String. Search is a wildcard to support partial match strings (e.g. `cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows` will match `cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_10_1607:-:*:*:*:*:*:x86:*`, `cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_10_1607:-:*:*:*:*:*:x64:*`, etc.

parameters.name: cve_vulnerable
parameters.description: Filters CPEs returned to those vulnerable to CVE ID specified. e.g. `CVE-2023-22518`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter the results by the STIX ID of the `software` object. e.g. `software--93ff5b30-0322-50e8-90c1-1c3f151c8adc`

parameters.name: in_cve_pattern
parameters.description: Filters CPEs returned to those referenced CVE ID specified (if you want to only filter by vulnerable CPEs, use the `cve_vulnerable` parameter. e.g. `CVE-2023-22518`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: Filters CPEs returned by product name. Is wildcard search so `chrom` will match `chrome`, `chromium`, etc.

parameters.name: product_type
parameters.description: Filters CPEs returned by product type.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Filters CPEs returned by vendor name. Is wildcard search so `goog` will match `google`, `googe`, etc.

400.description: The server did not understand the request

get.description: Retrieve a single STIX `software` object for a CPE using its STIX ID. You can identify a CPE ID using the GET CPEs endpoint.
get.summary: Get a CPE object by STIX ID

parameters.name: cpe_name
parameters.description: The full CPE name. e.g. `cpe:2.3:a:slicewp:affiliate_program_suite:1.0.13:*:*:*:*:wordpress:*:*`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

400.description: The server did not understand the request

get.description: This endpoint will return all SROs where the Software (CPE) selected is either a `source_ref` or a `target_ref`. This allows you to quickly find out what CVEs the CPE is found in.

parameters.name: cpe_name
parameters.description: The full CPE name. e.g. `cpe:2.3:a:slicewp:affiliate_program_suite:1.0.13:*:*:*:*:wordpress:*:*`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: relationship_type
parameters.description: either `vulnerable-to` or `in-pattern` (default is both).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort results by

400.description: The server did not understand the request

get.description:
Search and filter CVE records. This endpoint only returns the vulnerability objects for matching CVEs.

Once you have the CVE ID you want, you can get all associated data linked to it (e.g. Indicator Objects) using the bundle endpoint.

If you already know the CVE ID, use the Get a Vulnerability by ID endpoint

parameters.name: attack_id
parameters.description:
Filter results by weakness (ATT&CK ID). e.g. `T1223`.


filters using the `description` property of `cve-attack` relationship object

parameters.name: capec_id
parameters.description:
Filter results by weakness (CAPEC ID). e.g. `CAPEC-665`.


filters using the `description` property of `cve-capec` relationship object

parameters.name: cpes_in_pattern
parameters.description: Filter Vulnerabilities that contain a full or partial CPE Match String. Note, this will return Vulnerabilities that are vulnerable and not vulnerable (e.g. an operating system might not be vulnerable, but it might be required for software running on it to be vulnerable). Search is a wildcard to support partial match strings (e.g. `cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows` will match `cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_10_1607:-:*:*:*:*:*:x86:*`, `cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_10_1607:-:*:*:*:*:*:x64:*`, etc.)

parameters.name: cpes_vulnerable
parameters.description: Filter Vulnerabilities that are vulnerable to a full or partial CPE Match String. Search is a wildcard to support partial match strings (e.g. `cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows` will match `cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_10_1607:-:*:*:*:*:*:x86:*`, `cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_10_1607:-:*:*:*:*:*:x64:*`, etc.)

parameters.name: created_max
parameters.description: Is the maximum `created` value (`YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ`)

parameters.name: created_min
parameters.description: Is the minimum `created` value (`YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ`)

parameters.name: cve_id
parameters.description: Filter the results using a CVE ID. e.g. `CVE-2023-22518`

parameters.name: cvss_base_score_min
parameters.description: The minimum CVSS score you want. `0` is lowest, `10` is highest.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Filter the results by the description of the Vulnerability. Search is a wildcard, so `exploit` will return all descriptions that contain the string `exploit`.'

parameters.name: epss_percentile_min
parameters.description: The minimum EPSS percentile you want. Between `0` (lowest) and `1` highest to 2 decimal places (e.g. `9.34`).

parameters.name: epss_score_min
parameters.description: The minimum EPSS score you want. Between `0` (lowest) and `1` highest to 2 decimal places (e.g. `9.34`).

parameters.name: has_kev
parameters.description: Optionally filter the results to only include those reported by CISA KEV (Known Exploited Vulnerability).

parameters.name: modified_max
parameters.description: Is the maximum `modified` value (`YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ`)

parameters.name: modified_min
parameters.description: Is the minimum `modified` value (`YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ`)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort results by

parameters.name: stix_id
parameters.description: Filter the results using the STIX ID of a `vulnerability` object. e.g. `vulnerability--4d2cad44-0a5a-5890-925c-29d535c3f49e`.

parameters.name: vuln_status
parameters.description: Filter by the Vulnerability status.

parameters.name: weakness_id
parameters.description: Filter results by weakness (CWE ID). e.g. `CWE-122`. `cve-cwe` mode must be run in Arango CVE Processor first for this to work.

400.description: The server did not understand the request

get.description:
Return data for a CVE by ID. This endpoint only returns the `vulnerability` object for CVE.

If you want all the Objects related to this vulnerability you should use the bundle endpoint for the CVE.
get.summary: Get a Vulnerability by CVE ID

parameters.name: cve_id
parameters.description: The CVE ID, e.g `CVE-2023-22518`

parameters.name: cve_version
parameters.description: Return only vulnerability object where `modified` value matches query

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

400.description: The server did not understand the request

get.description:
This endpoint will return the vulnerability itself and all objects related to the Vulnerability. Use this endpoint to get the complete intelligence graph for this Vulnerability.

The results can include the following:

* `vulnerability`: Represents the CVE (source: cve2stix)
* `indicator`: Contains a pattern identifying products affected by the CVE (source: cve2stix)
* `relationship` (`indicator`->`vulnerability`) (source: cve2stix)
* `report`: Represents EPSS scores for the Vulnerability (source: cve2stix)
* `report`: Represents CISA KEVs for the Vulnerability (source: cve2stix)
* `software`: Represents the products listed in the pattern (source: cve2stix)
* `relationship` (`indicator`->`software`) (source: cve2stix)
* `weakness` (CWE): represents CWEs linked to the Vulnerability (source: arango_cve_processor, requires `cve-cwe` mode to be run)
* `relationship` (`vulnerability` (CVE) -> `weakness` (CWE)) (source: arango_cve_processor, requires `cve-cwe` mode to be run)
* `attack-pattern` (CAPEC): represents CAPECs linked to the Vulnerability (source: arango_cve_processor, requires `cve-capec` mode to be run)
* `relationship` (`vulnerability` (CVE) -> `attack-pattern` (CAPEC)) (source: arango_cve_processor, requires `cve-capec` mode to be run)
* `attack-pattern` (ATT&CK Enterprise): represents ATT&CKs linked to the Vulnerability (source: arango_cve_processor, requires `cve-attack` mode to be run)
* `relationship` (`vulnerability` (CVE) ->  `attack-pattern` (ATT&CK)) (source: arango_cve_processor, requires `cve-attack` mode to be run)
get.summary: Get all objects for a Vulnerability by CVE ID

parameters.name: cve_id
parameters.description: The CVE ID, e.g `CVE-2023-22518`

parameters.name: include_attack
parameters.description:
will show ATT&CK `attack-pattern` objects (for Techniques/Sub-techniques) related to this vulnerability, if exist (and the SROS linking capec-attack)
 * note this mode will also show `include_capec` and `include_cwe` outputs, due to the way ATT&CK is linked to CVE

parameters.name: include_capec
parameters.description:
will show CAPEC `attack-pattern` objects related to this vulnerability, if exist  (and the SROS linking cwe-capec)
 * note this mode will also show `include_cwe` outputs, due to the way CAPEC is linked to CVE

parameters.name: include_cpe
parameters.description: will show all `software` objects related to this vulnerability (and the SROS linking cve-cpe)

parameters.name: include_cpe_vulnerable
parameters.description: will show `software` objects vulnerable to this vulnerability (and the SROS), if exist. Note `include_cpe` should be set to `false` if you only want to see vulnerable cpes (and the SROS linking cve-cpe)

parameters.name: include_cwe
parameters.description: will show `weakness` objects related to this vulnerability, if exist (and the SROS linking cve-cwe)

parameters.name: include_epss
parameters.description: will show `note` objects related to this vulnerability, if exist

parameters.name: include_kev
parameters.description: will show `sighting` objects related to this vulnerability, if exist (and the SROS linking cve-sighting)

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: The type of STIX object to be returned

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

400.description: The server did not understand the request

get.description: This endpoint will return all SROs where the Vulnerability selected is either a `source_ref` or a `target_ref`. This allows you to quickly find out what objects the CVE is related to.
get.summary: Get Relationships for Vulnerability by CVE ID

parameters.name: cve_id
parameters.description: The CVE ID, e.g `CVE-2023-22518`

parameters.name: cve_version
parameters.description: Return only vulnerability object where `modified` value matches query

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

400.description: The server did not understand the request

get.description:
This endpoint will return all the times a Vulnerability has been modified over time as new information becomes available.

By default the latest version of objects will be returned by all endpoints. This endpoint is generally most useful to researchers interested in the evolution of what is known about a vulnerability. The version returned can be used to get an older versions of a Vulnerability.
get.summary: Get all updates for a Vulnerability by CVE ID

parameters.name: cve_id
parameters.description: The CVE ID, e.g `CVE-2023-22518`

400.description: The server did not understand the request

get.description: Get a STIX Object by its ID

parameters.name: object_id
parameters.description: Filter by the STIX object ID. e.g. `ipv4-addr--ba6b3f21-d818-4e7c-bfff-765805177512`, `indicator--7bff059e-6963-4b50-b901-4aba20ce1c01`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

get.description:
Search for STIX Cyber Observable Objects (aka Indicators of Compromise). If you have the object ID already, you can use the base GET Objects endpoint.

Note the `value` filter searches the following object properties;

* `artifact.payload_bin`
* `autonomous-system.number`
* `bank-account.iban_number`
* `bank-card.number`
* `cryptocurrency-transaction.hash`
* `cryptocurrency-wallet.hash`
* `directory.path`
* `domain-name.value`
* `email-addr.value`
* `email-message.body`
* `file.name`
* `ipv4-addr.value`
* `ipv6-addr.value`
* `mac-addr.value`
* `mutex.value`
* `network-traffic.protocols`
* `phone-number.number`
* `process.pid`
* `software.name`
* `url.value`
* `user-account.display_name`
* `user-agent.string`
* `windows-registry-key.key`
* `x509-certificate.subject`
get.summary: Search and filter STIX Cyber Observable Objects

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: post_id
parameters.description: Filter the results to only contain objects present in the specified Post ID. Get a Post ID using the Feeds endpoints.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Filter the results by one or more STIX SCO Object types

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
Search by the `value` field field of the SCO. This is the IoC. So if you're looking to retrieve a IP address by address you would enter the IP address here. Similarly, if you're looking for a credit card you would enter the card number here.
Search is wildcard. For example, `1.1` will return SCOs with `value` fields; `1.1.1.1`, `2.1.1.2`, etc.
If `value` field is named differently for the Object (e.g. `hash`) it will still be searched because these have been aliased to the `value` in the database search).

get.description: Search for domain objects (aka TTPs). If you have the object ID already, you can use the base GET Objects endpoint.
get.summary: Search and filter STIX Domain Objects

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description:
Allows results to be filtered on each value in the `labels` field of the SDO. Each value in the `labels` list will be searched individually.
Search is wildcard. For example, `needs` will return SDOs with `labels`; `need-attribution`, `needs-review`, etc. The value entered only needs to match one item in the `labels` list to return results.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Allows results to be filtered on the `name` field of the SDO. Search is wildcard. For example, `Wanna` will return SDOs with the `name`; `WannaCry`, `WannaSmile`, etc.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Filter the results by one or more STIX Domain Object types

get.description: Search for meta objects. If you have the object ID already, you can use the base GET Objects endpoint.
get.summary: Search and filter STIX Meta Objects

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Filter the results by one or more STIX Object types

get.description: Search for relationship objects. This endpoint is particularly useful to search what Objects an SCO or SDO is linked to.
get.summary: Search and filter STIX Relationship Objects

parameters.name: include_embedded_refs
parameters.description: If `ignore_embedded_relationships` is set to `false` in the POST request to download data, stix2arango will create SROS for embedded relationships (e.g. from `created_by_refs`). You can choose to show them (`true`) or hide them (`false`) using this parameter. Default value if not passed is `true`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: relationship_type
parameters.description: Filter the results on the `relationship_type` field. Search is wildcard. For example, `in` will return `relationship` objects with ``relationship_type`s; `found-in`, `located-in`, etc.

parameters.name: source_ref
parameters.description: Filter the results on the `source_ref` fields. The value entered should be a full ID of a STIX SDO or SCO which can be obtained from the respective Get Object endpoints. This endpoint allows for graph traversal use-cases as it returns STIX `relationship` objects that will tell you what objects are related to the one entered (in the `target_ref` property).

parameters.name: source_ref_type
parameters.description: Filter the results by the STIX object type in the `source_ref` field. Unlike the `source_ref` filter that requires a full STIX object ID, this filter allows for a more open search. For example, `attack-pattern` will return all `relationship` Objects where the `source_ref` contains the ID of an `attack-pattern` Object.

parameters.name: target_ref
parameters.description: Filter the results on the `target_ref` fields. The value entered should be a full ID of a STIX SDO or SCO which can be obtained from the respective Get Object endpoints. This endpoint allows for graph traversal use-cases as it returns STIX `relationship` objects that will tell you what objects are related to the one entered (in the `source_ref` property).

parameters.name: target_ref_type
parameters.description: Filter the results by the STIX object type in the `target_ref` field. Unlike the `target_ref` filter that requires a full STIX object ID, this filter allows for a more open search. For example, `attack-pattern` will return all `relationship` Objects where the `target_ref` contains the ID of an `attack-pattern` Object.

tags.name: CVE
tags.description: Download the latest CVE objects or view existing CVE objects.

tags.name: CPE
tags.description: Download the latest CPE objects or view existing CVE objects.

tags.name: Objects
tags.description: Explore all STIX Objects stored in Vulmatch.

tags.name: Arango CVE Processor
tags.description: Trigger the generation of relationships between objects.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description: Search through Vulmatch Jobs triggered when downloading data and creating relationships.
